snippet: The Assad government blamed technical failure in the downing of a fighter jet, but there was speculation about whether the opposition had acquired antiaircraft missiles.
abstract: Syrian rebels report they have shot down a Syrian fighter jet for the first time, raising new questions about the opposition’s military capabilities, and whether Syria’s control of the skies might be threatened; Syrian authorities insist that the jet crashed because of a technical failure; rebel groups and activists sought to win over skeptics by turning to YouTube; they posted one 33-second video showing a jet bursting into flames, and a second clip showing a man who identified himself as the ejected pilot.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by C. J. Chivers from Tal Rifaat, Syria; Dalal Mawad from Beirut; and Hwaida Saad and Sebnem Arsu from Antakya, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: The Assad government blamed technical failure in the downing of a fighter jet, but there was speculation about whether the opposition had acquired antiaircraft missiles.

headline.seo: Syrian Rebels Claim They Brought Down Jet
headline.main: Syrian Rebels Claim First Jet Downing, in Possible Shift for War
headline.print_headline: Syrian Rebels Claim First Jet Downing, in Possible Shift for War
